Description: Face of Serapis from mould made terracotta figure. Hollow and mould made (back missing) Traces of white coating. Brown Nile silt with grey core. Fine white, quartz and mica inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by City Art Gallery and Museum, Bristol. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Unprovenanced parallels in Tübingen and Dresden Museums have been dated to the 1st and 2nd centuries AD (Fisher nos 757, 769, 774). Fischer, J. 1994, Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber, Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen, Tübinger Studien zur Archäologie und Kunstgeschichte 14, Tübingen.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.254) (Phase 1)
